title: Spelling Patterns and Word Families

vocab.definition: Letters that repeat in the same way in different words
A group of words that end with the same sounds and letters
Words that end with the same sound
Letters that are not vowels (like b, c, d, f, g)
The letters a, e, i, o, u (and sometimes y)

teachingNotes: Focus on common word families like -at, -an, -ing, -ed endings. Use word sorts and pattern activities. Help students recognize spelling patterns to decode new words and improve spelling accuracy.

sample.question: What do we call words that end with the same sound?
Give an example of a word family.
Name two words in the -ed pattern.
Name two words in the -ing pattern.

truefalse.question: Words in the same family often have similar spelling patterns.
Rhyming words always have different endings.
The letters a, e, i, o, u are vowels.
Consonants and vowels are the same thing.

multiplechoice.question: Which word is in the -og family?
Which pair belongs to the -ing pattern?
Which ending makes 'talk' into past tense?

fillintheblank.question: Cat, bat, and hat all belong to the ________ word family.
Words that end with the same sound are called ________ words.
The letters a, e, i, o, u are ________.
B, c, d, f, and g are ________.
Dog, fog, and log are in the ________ family.
